pr_title: issue #1708 store compartment search parameters for faster compartment search queries

timeline.message:
issue #1708 add custom compartment reference params for faster compartment searches

Signed-off-by: Robin Arnold <robin.arnold23@ibm.com>

issue #1708 use ibm-internal stored parameters for compartment searches

Signed-off-by: Robin Arnold <robin.arnold23@ibm.com>

issue #1708 merge with master and handle NPE when search param is filtered out

Signed-off-by: Robin Arnold <robin.arnold23@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: clean up commented out lines (here and 48-54)
timeline.author: michaelwschroeder

replies.bodyText: thanks...cruft left over from some refactor back-and-forth
replies.author: punktilious

timeline.bodyText: Is this meant to be commented out?
timeline.author: michaelwschroeder

replies.bodyText: method wasn't supposed to be there at all. Removed.
replies.author: punktilious

timeline.author: michaelwschroeder

timeline.bodyText: I think this can all be replaced with FHIRConfigHelper.getBooleanProperty(FHIRConfiguration.PROPERTY_USE_STORED_COMPARTMENT_PARAM, false);
timeline.author: michaelwschroeder

timeline.bodyText: should wrap resourceType in single quotes
timeline.author: michaelwschroeder

replies.bodyText: It's now in ReferenceUtil, which has a much better algorithm for determining the base URL, along with unit tests
replies.author: punktilious

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be thrown as an error only.
timeline.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText:
see subsequent comment...
otherwise delimit the log message with a single quote.
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: It's an internal programming error, so I don't think the details need to be propagated to the outside world, but we still need to log the information to help debug the problem.
replies.author: punktilious

replies.bodyText: hum... then this should be logger.fine
replies.author: prb112

timeline.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: OK - so you moved the reference logic into. the ReferenceUtil
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: Correct, and ReferenceUtil is a much better implementation (logic-wise).
replies.author: punktilious

timeline.bodyText: I like having the single reference I can go back to and see - this was a good addition and comments.
timeline.author: prb112
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,74 @@
+/*
+ * (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2020
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+ */
+
+package com.ibm.fhir.search.util;
+
+
+/**
+ * A reference extracted from a FHIR resource, with processing applied to
+ * identify the reference type and target resource type
+ */
+public class ReferenceValue {
+
+    public static enum ReferenceType {
+        LITERAL_RELATIVE, // Patient/123abc
+        LITERAL_ABSOLUTE, // http(s)://an.other.server/Patient/234def
+        LOGICAL,          // e.g. SSN
+        DISPLAY_ONLY,     // A Reference with only a display field
+        INVALID           // Not a valid reference
+    }

timeline.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: perhaps declare as final and make the options constants within the class?
timeline.author: prb112

timeline.bodyText: so we can execute a single reindex?
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: Yes. I added this to debug the issue Karen/Lee identified. It's extremely handy!

timeline.bodyText:
This is where I like to static import the string method.
import static com.ibm.fhir.model.type.String.string;
string(diag)
makes it short and sweet

replies.bodyText: Yeah, this should be updated. Fixed

timeline.bodyText: seems like this should be final or treated as a constant.

timeline.bodyText: We should probably have a defense against say 10000000 resources get reindexed. What's a reasonable defense/upper limit?
timeline.author: prb112
